docs.abstract: The Democratic Party can seize defeat to establish a new order, but the era of tinkering around the edges is over.
docs.snippet: The Democratic Party can seize defeat to establish a new order, but the era of tinkering around the edges is over.
docs.lead_paragraph: In the months ahead, Democratic Party officials and operatives will analyze election returns and voting patterns to try to make sense of what happened on Election Day. There will be a push to identify problems that can be easily solved by the same campaign experts who have allowed one of the least popular politicians of our time to dominate politics for three consecutive elections and rewrite the political order in a way we haven’t seen since the Goldwater movement laid the groundwork for Ronald Reagan’s presidency.

headline.main: Democrats, It’s Time to Say Goodbye to Our Neoliberal Era

docs.abstract: Western countries are confronting demands for trillions of dollars to fight climate change and to cope with its worsening effects.
docs.snippet: Western countries are confronting demands for trillions of dollars to fight climate change and to cope with its worsening effects.
docs.lead_paragraph: A two-week marathon of climate talks has entered its grueling final dash with developed and developing nations still deadlocked over how many hundreds of billions of dollars wealthy countries should invest to help speed the global transition to cleaner energy and protect the most vulnerable countries against the drumbeat of catastrophes that accompany global warming.

headline.main: Climate Talks Teeter, With Rich and Poor Countries in a Tug of War

keywords.value: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change

docs.abstract: In scores of interviews throughout 2024, Latino, Black and Asian American voters, many of whom voted for Donald Trump, said they no longer trusted Democrats to improve the economy.
docs.snippet: In scores of interviews throughout 2024, Latino, Black and Asian American voters, many of whom voted for Donald Trump, said they no longer trusted Democrats to improve the economy.
docs.lead_paragraph: The working-class voters Vice President Kamala Harris’s presidential campaign needed were not moved by talk of joy. They were too angry about feeling broke.

headline.main: For Minority Working-Class Voters, Dismay With Democrats Led to Distrust
headline.print_headline: Broke, Dismayed and Distrusting of Democrats

docs.abstract: Senior ministers are arriving in an effort to break a deadlock over the summit’s main goal: funding to help lower-income countries hit hard by global warming.
docs.snippet: Senior ministers are arriving in an effort to break a deadlock over the summit’s main goal: funding to help lower-income countries hit hard by global warming.
docs.lead_paragraph: More than halfway through the United Nations climate talks in Baku, Azerbaijan, negotiators from nearly 200 countries remain far apart on a number of the key issues up for debate.

headline.main: Climate Talks Head Into the Final Stretch With Negotiators Far Apart
headline.print_headline: U.N. Climate Summit Enters Final Stretch With Negotiators Far Apart

byline.original: By David Gelles and Brad Plumer

docs.abstract: Laura Gillen was elected to Congress in Nassau County, where Democrats are grappling with a new political reality.
docs.snippet: Laura Gillen was elected to Congress in Nassau County, where Democrats are grappling with a new political reality.
docs.lead_paragraph: Nassau County, one of America’s first suburban counties and one of the wealthiest, is perhaps as good a place as any to begin to understand the current political mood.

headline.main: How a Democrat Turned Back the Trump Tide on Long Island
headline.print_headline: Lessons From a Flipped Congressional Seat

docs.abstract: Our nation needs an economic disaster preparedness tool kit to avoid the scourge of inflation.
docs.snippet: Our nation needs an economic disaster preparedness tool kit to avoid the scourge of inflation.
docs.lead_paragraph: Unemployment weakens governments. Inflation kills them. That’s what a government official from Brazil once told me. But in rich countries, including the United States, the politically destructive power of inflation had been forgotten. Standard policy tools left us unprepared, and the Biden administration was slow to fight back. The re-election of Donald Trump should serve as a warning to democratic governments.

headline.main: The Lesson of This Election: We Must Stop Inflation Before It Starts
headline.print_headline: We Must Stop Inflation Before It Starts

docs.abstract: Soaring rents and few options have made it hard for average people to live in the city. Even “affordable” units often cost too much.
docs.snippet: Soaring rents and few options have made it hard for average people to live in the city. Even “affordable” units often cost too much.
docs.lead_paragraph: This is The Housing Crunch, a five-part series on New York City’s affordable housing crisis.

headline.main: Why ‘Affordable Housing’ in New York City Can Still Cost $3,500 a Month

docs.abstract: Democrats can compete if they focus more on minimum wages and child care than pronouns and purity.
docs.snippet: Democrats can compete if they focus more on minimum wages and child care than pronouns and purity.
docs.lead_paragraph: The other day I was supposed to visit a friend who had been released from prison. He had to cancel to rescue his sister, who is using drugs again.
